result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Defendant Braxton C Smith in court, in custody with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter set for plea but is continued. Minutes filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 12, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Braxton C Smith in court, in custody with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant withdraws demand for speedy trial. Matter set over for pleah. Minutes filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

Defendant Braxton C Smith in court, in custody with attorney Rebecca Hammock. Intern Andrew Herrmann appeared under the supervision of Haley Jo Rea for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant wishes to waive his preliminary hearing. Court goes over waiver form with the defendant. State does not have an information, but indicates the charges will mirror the complaint. Not guilty plea entered and demand for speedy trial. Court sets matter on for same date and time as pending files with that date as motion deadline. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH PAUL OSHINSKI OR HIS RESDIENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Braxton C Smith in court, in custody with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Valerian A. Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing requested within time period. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 09:30 am.
